etymologies: mid 19th century: from French phénole, based on phène ‘benzene’

definitions: a mildly acidic toxic white crystalline solid obtained from coal tar and used in chemical manufacture, and in dilute form (under the name carbolic) as a disinfectant.
shortDefinitions: mildly acidic toxic white crystalline solid obtained from coal tar and used in chemical manufacture, and in dilute form (under name carbolic) as disinfectant

definitions: any compound with a hydroxyl group linked directly to a benzene ring

examples.text: many of these molecules are phenols

shortDefinitions: any compound with hydroxyl group linked directly to benzene ring
